snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said on Monday that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s proposal to curb the number of low-level marijuana arrests stemming from police stops “strikes the right balance.”
abstract: New York City Police Dept and Mayor Michael R Bloomberg endorse proposal to decriminalize the open possession of small amounts of marijuana, giving an unexpected lift to Gov Andrew M Cuomo's effort to cut down on the number of people arrested as a result of police stops; support is likely to carry significant weight in the Republican-led State Senate, which is the key obstacle to passage of the bill in Albany during the upcoming Legislative session.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said on Monday that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s proposal to curb the number of low-level marijuana arrests stemming from police stops “strikes the right balance.”

headline.main: Bloomberg Backs Plan to Limit Arrests for Marijuana
headline.print_headline: Police and Mayor Back Plan To Curtail Marijuana Arrests
